comment: This professor teaches as if she expects you to already understand the concepts. Test are given before you are actually getting the understanding of the material and there is no homework material to help give you a better understanding.

She is nice but does not excuse absences. She is understanding though. I have always had a hard time with math so maybe that is why I did not understand it all but I felt like she did not explain well enough and she would not explain problems a lot because she wants you to think about it, but if I have no idea how to do it I would like it explained
Great teacher explains problems several ways. Test were fairly easy I got 100 on a couple. Only hard part is article reviews and graded discussion board every week.

Mrs. Lischka is the best math instructor I've had so far at KSU. She has high expectations and you will work hard to earn your grade. I learned more in this class than any other math class I have ever taken. I don't think I would have passed the GACE without this class. She responded to my emails quickly any time I had questions.

By far one of the poorest experiences I've had. Her teaching style is hard to follow and she comes off quite condescending. Her exams were outrageously difficult. I do NOT recommend this teacher. Take her only if you wish to be stressed for an entire semester.

Honestly, this is an education class if you can't do simple K-5th grade math by now you need to pick a new major. She is a strict grader but she is not unfair, she takes off points for things that may confuse a student. If you do your work and you are very through in your answers the class is pretty easy.

One of the worst education classes that I have ever had at Kennesaw. She is a very strict grader, and ALWAYS finds something to take points off for when grading. She comes off as a harsh professor, and is not easily approachable.

She does grade on a strict grading scale, but she is one of the most wonderful professors i've ever had. i've learned so much in this class that i'll actually be able to take into my future classroom. i can't say the same for any of my other classes...i HIGHLY recommend this professor! you will leave the class actually feeling accomplished...

She's very nice and teaches well, but the tests are REALLY hard. They're very open ended and she requires a lot of writing and explanations for problems. There are a lot of homework grades (she grades for accuracy), quizes, and other grades, not just tests which can be good and bad! Overall it was difficult but I'd take her again.

She is knowledgeable, & she does hands on learning. HOWEVER, her grading is strict and test questions can be unclear. Be prepared to be able to know "something covered in class that is not on this test"! She takes 10 points off for "too simple" on tessellation assignment. Missing even ONE day will keep you from getting full credit on attendance!
